intro: Leandra hatschbachii, commonly known as the Mexican orchid, is a species native to Mexico. It is a member of the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded, humid environments. Its leaves are usually broad and elliptical, and it produces fragrant blooms in shades of white, yellow, and orange. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by horticulturists worldwide.
